intro: Ossaea pratensis, commonly known as the meadow ossaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ossaea pratensis is often found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
